alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Norfolk; City of Poquoson; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:46PM EST until December 18 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EST MONDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN YORK COUNTY AND THE CENTRAL CITY OF CHESAPEAKE, THE CITY OF HAMPTON, THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS, THE CITY OF NORFOLK, THE CITY OF POQUOSON, THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 1146 PM EST, the public and broadcast media reported flash flooding in Downtown Norfolk. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Old Dominion University, Hampton University, Churchland, Ocean View, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk State University, Langley AFB, Virginia Wesleyan University, Christopher Newport University, Regent University, Deep Creek, Kempsville, Patrick Henry Field, Great Bridge, Seaford and Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Norfolk; City of Poquoson; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach; York
